VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows:
The facility submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period. Special Investigation 2023C0000730SI
dated 10/02/2023 was investigated by DCWL and DHHS. This involved staff
hugging a youth, which is a violation of the “Unprofessional Boundaries” policy.
To this date, the agency has been in compliance with the CAP. All the staff
members were retrained on agency policy.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on a review of the facility’s
budget and the agency financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Annual Assessment addressed the prior violations and
there are no repeat violations. Overall, the facility makes ongoing efforts to
comply with licensing rules. The agency did not have any restraints or seclusion
for this period under review.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviewed reported feeling supported by their supervisor and upper
management. They reported they have the necessary training and tools to
provide care and supervision for all the children in the program.
3

The youths interviewed reported feeling safe, and all their needs are being met.
The youths stated they get enough food, participate in individual and group
therapy, and staff are always supervising.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the secured and non-secured boys' and
girls' units occurred on 04/12/2024. The facility was found to be clean, neat, and
furnished appropriately to meet the needs of the youths.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
